visual.name: Windows Magnifier
visual.desc: Magnify all or part of your screen for clarity

visual.name: Dark Mode
visual.desc: For those who find bright displays problematic or helps distinguish between things that differ only by color by applying the color filter

visual.name: Read Aloud
visual.desc: Reads all or part of a document

visual.name: Immersive Reader
visual.desc: Reads post, chat messages, and assignments aloud

visual.name: Dictate
visual.desc: Helps users create documents, emails, notes, and presentation slide notes by using one’s voice instead of typing it out

visual.name: NVDA (NonVisual Desktop Access)
visual.desc: Screen reader for Microsoft Windows computers

visual.name: Windows Narrator
visual.desc: Assists users through easy interaction with the screen without the use of mouse and narrates and interacts with things on the screen.

visual.name: Natural Reader
visual.desc: Read any text such as word doc, webpages, PDF files and emails through a natural-sounding text-to-speech

visual.name: JAWS (Jobs Access with Speech)
visual.desc: Provides speech and Braille output for the most popular computer applications on PC

visual.name: SofType5
visual.desc: A software utility which replaces the functionality of a desktop keyboard with a full feature, on-screen keyboard

visual.name: ZoomText
visual.desc: A stand-alone software that helps user to magnify the text in screen up to 60 times and enable the text to speech feature

visual.name: Braillenote Touch 32 Plus
visual.desc: Uses Braille literacy to create multiple language profiles and customize them with a large selection of braille codes and voices to choose from

visual.name: Focus 40 Blue
visual.desc: The Focus 40 Blue refreshable braille display provides a compact, tactile interface to your computer

auditory.name: Closed Captions (Teams)
auditory.desc: Through Teams' live transcription feature, users can view live subtitles of the spoken in-meeting communication

auditory.name: Closed Captions (Zoom)
auditory.desc: Through Zoom’s live transcription feature, users can view live subtitles of the spoken in-meeting communication

auditory.name: Naturally Speaking
auditory.desc: Helps users voice recognition in dictation with speech transcribed as written text, recognition of spoken commands, and text-to-speech

other.name: Windows Ease of Access
other.desc: Contains all the tools such as display, cursor and pointer, magnifier, color filters, high contrast, and narrator

other.name: Accessibility Checker
other.desc: Makes Microsoft Office content easy to read and edit to the receiver of the files

other.name: Microsoft Translator
other.desc: Available for Word, Excel, OneNote, Outlook, and PowerPoint to translate between 90 languages and dialects
